title: BBC Local Live: Sheffield and South Yorkshire on Wednesday 9 November - BBC News
summary: live updates have finished on wednesday 9 november 2016 .

documents.title: goodbye here are five things we learnt today
text: that 's it for today , thank you for joining us !
i 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow morning with all the latest news , weather , travel and sport for south yorkshire .
but before i go here are five things we learnt today
it 'll be a cloudy and cool night but we 're not expecting any snow in the forecast .
so here 's a great photo of some celebrities enjoying today 's snow in hoyland nether
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: sheffield retail quarter moves forward
text: work is taking place to move forward the development of sheffield retail quarter .
a pulveriser is knocking down the former grosvenor house hotel to allow the development to take place .
you can get a look at the demolition in action below
this is a pulveriser .
and it 's bringing down the former grosvenor house hotel to make way for the new @ twitterid
congratulations on writing a great uk gov tweet .
( ranked 32nd for nov 9 . )
extremely pleased to see demolition work commencing for the srq and hsbc
is this an electoral metaphor ?
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: barnsley teenager charged with anti-social behaviour
text: a 15-year-old boy from barnsley has been charged with an anti-social behaviour offence .
the teenager was given a section 5 public order offence .
it was after a group of teenagers were asked to leave a cafe in the town 's interchange after allegedly becoming abusive towards staff and customers .
the boy can not be identified for legal reasons .
he 's due to appear at barnsley youth court on the 22nd november .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: moor life-saving rescue is praised
text: moor life-saving rescue is praised

documents.title: barnsley firefighters grant 8 year old cancer patient 's wish
text: a sheffield boy who 's battling cancer has had his dreams of being a firefighter come true .
eight-year-old kasabian newton-smith from parson cross has been fighting cancer since he was two years old .
kasabian joined the crew at barnsley fire station for the day .
firefighter kasabian got to grips with the fire engine and then was called out to his first incident ( which was simulated especially for him ) .
then he was shown the cutting gear used in traffic collisions and by the end of the day was issuing instructions to the crew !
kasabian started off very shy at the beginning of the day , but once he 'd had his first call out and had a go in the engine , he was giving me my orders ! ''
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: doncaster bakery cooplands taken over by cooplands !
text: 150 jobs and 29 cooplands bakery stores have been taken over by cooplands .
the doncaster-based cooplands parent firm alison 's coffee shops has been taken over by cooplands retail ltd , a firm which was created after a previous split in the south yorkshire bakery .
it means cooplands will continue to trade with the same brand name the doncaster bakery has had since 1885 .
the new owners say they 're pleased with the deal .
we are pleased to be continuing the hard work that had gone on over the preceding two years to return cooplands to its former glories .
customers are returning and sales are increasing once more . ''
author: Danni Hewson
Business Correspondent, BBC Look North

documents.title: rescuers tell story of dramatic 'life or death ' rescue in langsett
text: i 've been speaking to the team behind the dramatic rescue of a lost walker in the moors near langsett .
the snowy weather meant that the raf and police helicopters had to pull out of the rescue effort .
now the woodhead mountain rescue team have been telling me about how they were able to save the man 's life .
the team have told the story in their own words :
`` in the first snowstorm of the winter season the woodhead mountain rescue team were called to look for a lost walker in the moors near langsett yesterday eveing .

the walker was able to raise the alarm with a mobile phone and was carefully quizzed by team members expert in local knowledge of the moorland to identify the most likely area the walker would be found .
a hasty search party was quickly dispatched to locate the walker in very cold and snowy conditions with limited visibility .
on finding the walker who was very cold and likely to be suffering from hypothermia the team provided shelter , a warm drink and food before looking to evacuate from the moorland .
the lost walker was unable to walk anymore and so was wrapped in a casualty blanket and secured onto a stretcher to carry off the moorland .

a rescue helicopter had arrived in the location but was unable to land due to the difficult weather conditions meaning that the stretcher carry was left to the 18 volunteer team members who were now on the moorland .

the stretcher carry was made treacherously slippy by the fast falling snow and took a real team effort to carry the stretcher for 1hour 30mins to get the lost walker to the road head where the ambulance was waiting .
this is the teams 34th call out of the year so far and involved 25 team members .
it lasted 6 hours from the alarm being raised to the lost walker reaching the ambulance . ''
this was a real case of life or death in those conditions .
if the alarm had not been raised the situation could have easily been a lot worse . ''
author: Tom Ingall
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: the best of your south yorkshire snow photos
text: we 've seen our first snow of the winter - so everyone got their cameras and mobiles snapping !
among them were our amazing bbc weather watchers .
so we 've some of the best photos they sent us of the snow
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: cctv released after thousands of pounds of clothes stolen in bawtry
text: police have released cctv images of three men they want to speak to after thousands of pounds worth of clothes were stolen from a shop in bawtry .
items including shirts and jeans were stolen last thursday night from robinsons of bawtry .
three men , who are said to be in the late teens and early twenties , broke into the stock room after failing to get into the main shop floor .
it 's believed the trio then left in a silver ford mondeo with black alloy wheels .
anyone with information is asked to contact south yorkshire police on 101 .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: south yorkshire mps react to 'bedroom tax ' court defeat
text: two appeal cases have been won at the supreme court against the so-called `` bedroom tax '' .
the court ruled that the government 's changes to housing benefit discriminated against a woman who suffers from spina bifida and a couple who look after their severely disabled grandson .
some south yorkshire mps have been reacting to the news
glad common sense has overturn decisive bedroom tax discrimination
great news
this cruel tax needs to be abolished .
so many facing eviction or ca n't pay bills .
wrong for everybody affected .
good that courts give some protection to disabled people hit by bedroom tax .
it 's no way to fix the housing crisis
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: doncaster bakery cooplands enters administration
text: doncaster-based bakery firm cooplands has entered administration .
it 's parent company alison 's coffee shop called in administrators yesterday putting around 200 jobs at risk .
it comes months after the firm closed two bakeries in lincolnshire without notice .
it 's not the first time the firm entered administration .
back in february 2015 , previous financial issues saw cooplands close 39 stores as well as it 's head office and production facilities in doncaster .
that led to 300 people losing their jobs last year .
author: Danni Hewson
Business Correspondent, BBC Look North

documents.title: two and a half years more for doncaster gp jailed for historic sex offences
text: a former doctor from doncaster has been given more time in jail for a string of indecent assaults against his patients .
64-year-old andrew johnson from bawtry has been sentenced to an additional two and a half years in prison , which brings his total jail term to over 14 years .
the offending took place between 1978 and 1997 at johnson 's gp surgeries in doncaster .
two of johnson 's victims were under 16 at the time of the abuse and his youngest victim was aged just 12 .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: darth vader 's south yorkshire mystery solved !
text: do you remember our post yesterday about darth vader walking down the a61 towards barnsley ?
well we 're pleased to say the mystery has been solved !
darth vader was passing through as part of pudseys imperial march walking from scotland to london for bbc children in need .
he even found time for some good old yorkshire bitter
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: 10 arrests after rail track thefts raids in south yorkshire
text: ten people have been arrested after dawn raids across south yorkshire .
british transport police investigating the theft of around £ 2 million of rail track carried out searches at twelve addresses in the county , including homes and scrap metal dealers
three of the arrested men ran scrap metal dealerships in the county .
a number of vehicles were seized while stolen scrap metal and large amounts of cash was discovered at two of the premises searched .
over 100 officers were involved including specialist officers from the force 's high tech crime unit , as well as dogs specialised in finding cash .
anyone with information is asked to contact british transport police on 0800 405040 .

the arrests made this morning as part of operation ultimatum , are the result of a 6 month investigation into the theft of £ 2million of rail track by an organised crime group from 44 line side locations and depots in south yorkshire , lincolnshire , nottinghamshire and birmingham . ''
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: root hopes england continue good start
text: root hopes england continue good start

documents.title: cctv released after elsecar burglary
text: detectives in barnsley have released a cctv image of a man they want to speak to after a burglary in elsecar .
a number of hand tools were stolen from a house on welland crescent at some point between 19:00 on thursday 20th october and 12:00 on saturday 22nd october .
anyone with information is being asked to contact south yorkshire police on 101 .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: weather : no snow but ice could be a problem for south yorkshire
text: the snow seems to have calmed down after this morning 's excitement .
so who better to ask for an official all clear than our very own owain wyn evans
but unfortunately , there 's a new weather issue to keep our eye on
we 'll have the latest from owain and the look north weather team throughout the afternoon .
but if you ca n't wait - why not head over the bbc weather website ?
rain sleet and snow for some of us this morning .
clearing to the east
hi owain .
are we safe to sound the all clear on the snow @ twitterid local live ?
thanks kevin
hey kevin , snow easing this afternoon but ice forming overnight .
could cause issues tomorrow !
thanks owain .
we 'll get the warning out there !
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: five arrests in child sex investigation
text: five arrests in child sex investigation

documents.title: high court case to decide chesterfield 's devolution future
text: i 'm at the high court in london following a court case which could have big implications for south yorkshire .
judges will decide if chesterfield will be allowed to join the sheffield city region 's devolution deal , which includes an elected mayor .
chesterfield borough council is in favour but derbyshire county council is challenging their breakaway .
the county says when the public was asked about the idea , they asked the wrong people about the wrong things at the wrong time .
we 'll hear what the sheffield city region has to say later .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: mountain rescue save lost pensioner near stocksbridge
text: a 77-year-old man has been rescued after getting lost in the countryside near stocksbridge .
the pensioner strayed from a path around langsett reservoir at around 18:40 last night .
due to the poor weather , the police helicopter and raf search and rescue teams had to withdraw .
fortunately , the mountain rescue team were able to find the man - cold but uninjured .
south yorkshire police say the team saved the man 's life .
they helped us save a life yesterday evening and i wish to publicly thank them for their support . ''
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: watch : are we in in for more snow fall ?
text: so are we in for more snow ?
here 's the latest :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: travel : one lane re-opens but traffic still heavy on the sheffield parkway
text: we 've just had an update from south yorkshire police about the closure on the sheffield parkway
parkway update lane 2 now open out of city towards m1 j33 .
still extremely congested .
thankyou for your patience @ twitterid
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: breaking200 jobs at risk as doncaster bakers goes into administration
text: two hundred jobs are at risk as doncaster-based cooplands bakeries goes into administration .
it 's the second time the business has hit difficulties .
author: Danni Hewson
Business Correspondent, BBC Look North

documents.title: sheffield muslims raise thousands for poppy appeal
text: members of sheffield young muslims have been out raising thousands of pounds for this year 's poppy appeal .
over the past nine years , members of the ahmadiyya muslim youth association ( amya ) have nationally raised over £ 150,000 for them through the poppy appeal .
this is true islam .
as muslims it is our responsibility to show loyalty to our country of residence and work for the betterment of our country . ''
author: Shawkat Hashmi
BBC Sheffield

documents.title: steelworkers march against cheap imports
text: steelworkers march against cheap imports

documents.title: snow : some roads a bit slippy - take care !
text: i 'm out and about chasing snowflakes in south yorkshire .
some of the roads - like this one on the way to strines - are a bit slippery .
the advice from police is to take care on the roads if you 're heading out .
a bit slippy on the road to strines .
should have stopped at the pub for a hot toddy .
@ twitterid @ twitterid
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
@ twitterid should av ad a poo b4 u set off tom !
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid great advice to drink and drive in icy conditions a recipe for disaster
author: Tom Ingall
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: totally toseland ! were you at our gig last night ?
text: we had a great time at bbc radio sheffield last night with an amazing gig .
south yorkshire legend james toseland was born in donny , grew up in kiveton park and performed for us last night .
the former two time world superbike champion has now launched a flourishing musical career as the front man for toseland .
get a look at one his songs from our gig last night
you 'll be able to listen to the gig on saturday at 17:05 on bbc radio sheffield .
if you were there send us a tweet on @ twitterid - we 'd love to hear from you !
author: Rob Staton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: cricket : root out after reaching his 11th test match century
text: sheffield 's joe root has hit his 11th test match century to put england on top in the first test against india in rajkot .
but shortly afterwards root was out for 124 - caught and bowled by umesh .
here 's commentary of the moment he reached three figures on the bbc test match special .
author: Andy Giddings
Sports Editor, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: rival fans charged with violent disorder
text: rival fans charged with violent disorder

documents.title: kindness of strangers helps barnsley man rebuild his pigeon loft
text: we love a happy ending !
after an arson attack killed scores of racing pigeons in barnsley , hundreds of people have helped john rebuild his lofts
author: Mick Lunney
Barnsley reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: happy birthday charlie ! tv presenter celebrates surviving malaria battle
text: a tv presenter from sheffield who survived a battle with malaria which put her into a coma is celebrating a birthday she did n't think she 'd see .
charlie webster has been tweeting this morning
on a lighter note .
i made it to my birthday , wearing my presents & look how lovely my brother is 'i could n't find a 34 ballon ' # birthday

documents.title: cricket : joe root leads england to recovery
text: sheffield 's joe root and moeen ali shared an unbroken century partnership as england reached 209-3 at tea on the first day of the first test against india in rajkot .
having lost three wickets before lunch things did n't look good , but root 's 93 and moeen 's 48 have helped to turn around england 's fortunes before the break .
author: Andy Giddings
Sports Editor, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: trump victory : ukip says 'establishment losing grip on the people '
text: turning away from the wintry weather to the somewhat more significant news across the atlantic , we 've had some local reaction to president-elect trump .
steve winstone , from ukip in sheffield , told me : `` the establishment are definitely losing their grip on the people . ''
some of our local mps have taken to twitter to give their views
if trump governs as he ran , this poses huge threat to nato & real challenge to already stretched u.k. armed forces .
- stop your scaremongering - as an mp you should know better !
which bit of what i said is open to question ?
nato is impotent , the world has been impotent , it is time for backbone and conviction , the world is too bland .
the american ppl just sent a message to the `` establishment ' - stupid as it was - they 've had enough .
he does n't want war .
yes , you are absolutely right .
we just averted ww3 you warmongering neo-liberal shit !
she made the same mistake as you remoaner 's made in not listening to the worries of every day folk !
he listened and won
can only hope he did that to energise and appeal to his base .
hopefully he 'll be more pragmatic .
not convinced but can hope .
at least he 's not going to invade syria !
he 's not a warmonger .
cue days of the british left coming to all the wrong conclusions
@ twitterid @ twitterid is n't democracy wonderful ?
great seeing it in action .
one vote each , our most valuable asset .
a shame some of our mps , like clegg , smith , soubry do n't agree .
democracy will prevail .
i could n't agree more .
@ twitterid you spelt decades wrong
@ twitterid clinton was n't left wing enough # trump
you @ twitterid must not be so complacent .
do n't imply that you on the right of the left know better @ twitterid @ twitterid
@ michaeldugher so much easier to patch up your worldview and defend it from harsh reality than change it .
@ twitterid you are inspirational but in the wrong party .
cue people like you not understanding that the biggest problem was people not trusting politicians !
oh if only it was going to be days - cue the years until the right wipe us clean away here too
it 's the strange idea that things could n't be worse than a narrow defeat .
just wait til these tories have an 80 seat majority
@ twitterid so what 's your conclusion ?
`` it 's the economy stupid '' - left behind white voters backed trump 's economic populism & stuck 2 fingers up to washington elite .
@ twitterid it 's not just the economy here or in usa immigration is a big issue but often an unspoken subconscious one
concerns about the impact of immigration is also fundamentally an economic issue
not just economic issue some feel areas of their towns and cities are being taken over bradford burnley etc
@ twitterid but lower income groups backed clinton ?
middle income and rich whites backed trump .
race a bigger factor .
@ twitterid like 'northern labour voters ' & brexit , this is false narrative -majority working class whites voted clinton .
but maybe not in the right places re electoral college .
left ( global ) needs to recognise # leftbehind @ twitterid
just like 17.4 million of us stuck 2 up to the european elite !
same with # brexit
no it 's not
nothing like an underdog and rebelling against authority to galvanise people into action
so # trump is not the # elite just like # farage # desmond # murdock # rothersmere et al ?
# uselection2016
why did left behind black voters not think of doing the same thing ?
yes , they all borrowed more than they could afford , crashed the global economy and now they 've elected trump to fix it
'left behind voters ' - how to keep nation onboard while tackling global challenges - climate , migration , inequality .
it patently is n't
what about the latino voters ?
it 's not just the economy .
wake up .
labour 's march to the left will mean our oblivion need to get back to middle ground and let the tories continue right .
corbyn is doing the same .
take note please .
decent left of centre politics defeated by divisive right wing populism .
repercussions will be felt around the world incl here .
get ready .
@ twitterid left of centre ?
democrats are right of uk centre and more like the tories than labour .
gop are the tory right .
actually is not as simple as that !
democratic party is a very broad church !
bernie sanders tory ? ? ?
and sanders is on the extreme of the party .
trump was a democrat .
the dems are hardly favouring an nhs .
hillary was hawkish .
trump is trump !
he stated years ago that he 'd run as a republican because they are stupid and believe all on fox news .
i do n't think he ever did .
interesting .
so will he support universal healthcare ?
personally i think he 's a loose cannon .
with no leadership from the centre .
time for people like you to step up dan , your party is currently irrelevant .
it ca n't because there are millions of labour voters who will not vote for corbyn
18 point tory lead .
it 's a fact .
obviously people think decent left of centre politics is n't working dan , there 's a reason that the uk and us have voted this way
to pretend hillary clinton is the us version of shirley williams misunderstands the nature of us politics .
author: Toby Foster
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: disruption on east midlands trains between sheffield and london
text: there 's some disruption on east midlands trains between sheffield and london .
it 's not because of snow - instead faulty signals in luton are to blame .
there 'll be fewer trains and those that are running will see delays of up to 20 minutes .
if you want to avoid the disruption , your ticket will be accepted if you want to travel to london via doncaster instead .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: first snow of the season - but no snow travel disruption so far
text: i 've travelled to the hope valley in search of snow - and found it !
the good news is there seems to be no major disruption on the roads .
the woodhead pass was closed earlier this morning but it is now open as normal .
if you see any disruption then tweet us on @ twitterid if it 's safe to do so !
a view back along the hope valley from outside speedwell cavern .
pretty - but no disruption i 've seen .
@ twitterid
author: Tom Ingall
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: weather : rain , sleet and snow clearing to the east
text: good morning !
so it 's starting to seem like the snow maybe is n't as bad in south yorkshire as we were worrying about last night .
what 's left of the snow , sleet and rain should clear during the morning .
i 've got the full details for you below
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: the latest from our south yorkshire snowchaser
text: i 'm out and about across south yorkshire chasing the snow .
we 're starting to see it fall more heavily and give a dusting to the north of sheffield .
here 's a snap i took in a layby of the a616 stocksbridge bypass a little earlier
if you have any information on the snow where you are - why not tweet us on @ twitterid
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: good morning welcome to our live coverage for south yorkshire
text: good morning , it 's kevin here .
i 'll be with you until 18:00 with the latest news , weather , travel and sport for south yorkshire .
of course , we 'll be keeping a close eye on the snow which is falling - albeit a bit more slushy and wet than we expected last night !
thanks to our weather watcher the wendy house for taking this snap of the snow in stannington
we love getting your photos so if you 've got some snow photos tweet them to us on @ twitterid or e-mail them to us .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield
